channel.title: Making a Website with R and the Blogdown Package
channel.description: Recent content on Making a Website with R and the Blogdown Package

item.title: Lesson 1 - Install Blogdown
item.description: You need both R and RStudio IDE. R is a programming language for statistical computing and graphics while R Studio is an integrated development environment (IDE) that provides a user-friendly platform.

item.title: Lesson 2 - A Quick Start
item.description: In this lesson, you will build the example site of the academic theme. Later, we will modify the elements of this website. Our aim is to teach you the structure of folders so that you can apply a similar logic while using other themes.

item.title: Lesson 3 - Menu of Your Website
item.description: In this lesson, there is a short discussion of “projects” in R. Then, we will be back to working on the website to learn how to create the menu of your website.

item.title: Lesson 4 - Themes, Colors, Fonts
item.description: In the academic theme, you have the flexibility of creating your own color and font theme. Follow along to learn more. params.toml is like your make-up kit, but instead of blush and mascara, you have theme, color, font, fontsize, etc.

item.title: Lesson 5 - Widgets Part I
item.description: WIDGETS ðŸŽ¯ are built-in designs for your website. Not every theme has widgets, but the academic theme has lots of them. We will look at them one by one and discuss how you can modify them in your website.

item.title: Lesson 6 - Widgets Part II
